commit message: Merge branch 'release'
add 'clean' to makefile - quick clean of mobile project
bump version in preperation for next release

artifact refresh: reduce to once per hour, but synchronise to close to the hour mark to keep the data fresh
a small random jitter is added to the refresh time to prevent a large number of requests at the exact same time

try to use the stock intel site map zoom->detail level loopup, to allow that to be changed at the Niantic end and IITC to match
catch errors and fallback to the currently known values
(is this a good idea? good question...)
some cleanups on build.py - in preperation for not updating date/time in file versions when no other changes occur
add (back) code to enxure tooltips close in player tracker - some browsers are buggy without it

playertracker: close all tooltips before markers are redrawn
fixes tooltip fragments on firefox
playertracker: don't close tooltip on touchdevices...touchdevices don't have a tooltip for player markers

portal highlighter system
- add an alternative API that includes a setSelected callback, so highlighters know when they're turned on/off
- fix bug where highlighters were selected multiple times
- a few other cleanups
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/jonatkins/ingress-intel-total-conversion
Use static initializer instead of private static method
Sort intents in share activity
Show frequently used intents on top

Don't add on click events on dialog open
Instead add them once durring setup
This fixes an issue where click events would fire x amount of times
depending on how many times the dialog was opened and closed, on even
times sort would run twice and not toggle.
some code formatting
disable JS on kitkat too if mDisableJs is true

Merge pull request #647 from Fragger/sortfix

Don't add on click events on dialog open
increase parallel requests - this matces behaviour of stock intel site, and speeds things up a bit

bookmarks plugin: fix error caused by missing hook parameters.
i've guessed as to what was expected here, but they don't seem to be used much anyway

bookmarks plugin
- fix auto draw to pass the right options (line/polygon) - otherwise geodesic lines can show a fill due to the curve
- add note about API needed in draw tools plugin for this to use
always exit app when map is focused and back button is pressed (fix for #650)
sort artifact list by shard number, then by target portals

ensure we don't break for artifacts without jarvis data (e.g. a future artifact type)
make shard marker semi-transparent - avoids the harsh white outline and makes the underlying portal and it's colour partly visible

geodesic lines: improve the handling for lines that extend beyond the antimeridian. no odd straight line segments
leaflet doesn't have particularly great handling for this, but this is a reasonable measure for now

leaflet 0.7 release
hopefully improves things further, especially on kitkat
Fix a couple of typos.

Merge pull request #653 from nexushoratio/to-push

Fix a couple of typos.

basemap cleanups
- updated Google, Bing and Yandex externals from https://github.com/shramov/leaflet-plugins
- also renamed Google file, removed internal hacks for INGRESS map type
- used external included file for Bing maps, instead of embedded in the plugin
- used Google map tile API to set the options for the INGRESS and 'Google Grey' map layers
cache bing maps metadata - without this likely to exceed free quota for map tiles
Spell checking, a-c.

Merge pull request #654 from nexushoratio/to-push

Spell checking, a-c.
Spell checking, d-g.
Merge remote-tracking branch 'upstream/master' into to-push

getAvgResDist - return a small, but non-zero, value for zero distance resonator deployments (zero is already assumed to be no resonators deployed)
portal-highlighter-bad-deployment-distance: highlight colour based on resonatror range: purple: likely 0m deployment (spoofer?), red <10m, orange under 24m, yellow under 36m otherwise no highlight
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/jonatkins/ingress-intel-total-conversion

Merge pull request #655 from nexushoratio/to-push

Spell checking, d-g.

request munging: call the stock site nemesis.dashboard.requests.normalizeParamCount function, to add in dummy parameters to requests
for #656 number 1

limit the number of player names resolved in one go, to prevent excessive requests
for #656 number 4

COMM: correctly use the ascendingTimestampOrder flag when retrieving new COMM messages. this matches the stock intel site, and prevents gaps occuring when filling in entries after resuming from idle
related to #656 no 2

reduce the number of 'all' comm messages retrieved in one go to 50 at a time
related to #656 no 2

re-order the common method name & version parameters in the JSON requests to match the stock intel site
for #656
Spell checking, h-r.
Spell check, missed one.

Merge pull request #657 from nexushoratio/to-push

Spell checking, h-r.

updates to the portal detail level handling
- iitc now defaults to lower detail than the standard intel site when zoomed out - it loads much faster, shows more than enough for general use, and is less likely to trigger 'excessive requests' issues
- show more portals plugin: updated for interface changes
- show-less-portals-zoomed-out: deleted (this is now the IITC default)
- new plugin: default-intel-detail - restores the original IITC behaviour on zoom to portal detail level mapping. not recommended

for #656 number 3
Spell checking, s-z, plus a couple of missed ones.

Merge pull request #658 from nexushoratio/to-push

Spell checking, s-z, plus a couple of missed ones.

bumpped jquery + jqueryui versions.
now the stock intel site no longer includes any version of these there are no advantages to non-current releases

Merge pull request #661 from nexushoratio/to-push

s/mazZoom/maxZoom/
partial update of munge set - it doesn't get things working though
website: add news of severe IITC breakage
website: minor fix

deleted the existing JSON examples - many were out of date
added a new request and response example for map data - more to come for other requests
website: removed downloads - added brief note to news post
json_examples - get_portal_details (request+response)
json example: artifacts
new reduced map data: first pass at loading the new format

if munge detection fails, don't guess and try set 0 - instead fail, and throw an exception
this will prevent IITC making any requests to the server when a munge set cannot be found - safer than sending bad requests
decrease retry count on failed requests, and increase delay before retrying. another step to help reduce issues when IITC breaks due to site changes
bump version number

bump version for mobile app too - just so it's clear it's separate from the broken 0.9 release
no app changes made

move a bunch of plugins into a 'broken' subfolder, for now
this is a quick way to remove them from test builds as they're unlikely to be practical to fix for 0.16.0 release

change portal map data storage to match the method used for links/fields
the detailed portal data, now retreived separately from the map, will be handled by separate code, and not stored within the portals

first update of sidebar for new data format: show the info available from the brief portal data
TODO: retrieve the full portal data and update to include that
fix artifact list

misc fixes - some untested
- no GUIDs in chat for players or portal details - so remove player GUID related functions
- remove player guid code from COMM
- update portal_info functions to compare to player name rather than guid
first attempt at loading portal details, and displaying in the sidebar once loaded
plugin: portal-level-numbers fixed
plugin: portal-names fixed
plugin: debug-raw-data fixed

plugin: fix portal-highlighter-needs-recharge
also added colour variations to indicate severity at a glance

fix for new player id field in plext

Signed-off-by: Carsten <strobel.carsten@gmail.com>

plugin: portal-counts fixed
also reformatted the table a little - moved totals into the columns below the L8 to L1 lists, then neutral after that
bugfix: the new map data format returns unclaimed portals as level 1 - but IITC needs them handled as level 0
plugin: level colour highlighter fixed
tweaks to level number plugin
plugin: fix infrastructure problem highlighter
remove file execute bit - not sure why it was set!

Merge pull request #664 from strobel1x/master

fix for new player id field in plext
plugin: player tracker - bump version number
plugin: player tracker. something odd was happening in the case of $.each and 'this' in the loop function - so changed to use parameters to functions
plugin: bookmarks fix

for all of the plugins moved to plugins/broken, add a dummy placeholder file
this contains the userscript header, but with @category Deleted, @description CURRENTLY UNAVAILABLE
this is so users wondering where a script has gone have some information
plugin: bugfix: zero health IS possible for a very badly damaged portal (one resonator under 1% health)
plugin: zaprange updated for data changes
plugin: missing resonators fixed

method to attempt to find a portal lat/lng from guid, even if the portal data isn't available (we can also search through links and fields) - minimal testing
added note concerning unfinished/temporary nature of the portal details API

plugin: max-links
- fix for API changes
- change to perform triangulation in screen coordinates, rather than lat/lng treated as x/y coords. gives better triangulation
- ignore portals outside the viewport for triangulation purposes - prevents artifact portals adding long triangles off the edge of the screen
fix portal 40m range circle and link distance circle
Fix guess-player-levels
Fixed exception when selecting a neutral portal

Fix guess-player-levels

plugin: guess player levels
- code to clear the now obsolete 'level-PLAYER_GUID' keys removed from reset guesses, and moved to plugin startup
- version number bumpped
guess player levels: change text on dialog
add back portal image tooltip, and description in large image view

tweaked default portal detail levels to show L7 portals one more step out. this helps seeing the larger-scale links and fields
IITC still switches to L8 portals one level sooner than default intel though - and this seems about right for the current level of portals commonly seen

more plugins disabled, as they're going to be hard to fix with the recent changes
also fix missing category from players-resonators dummy deleted plugin

moved favorite-portals and ipas-link to broken plugin folder - created dummy deleted files

correct maths in updated portal weakness - oops
fix farm finder plugin
